description: ORM Framework - Easy and simple to use.
releaseNotes:
.Net Framework
		Supports SQL Server by default. 
	
		Start with just n simple steps:
		1) Create a class to represent a database table/model.
		2) Derive it from AbstractEntity.
		3) Create properties to represents the fields for that model.
		4) Decorate the properties with [DbField, DbKey, DbIdentity, DbRequired]
			[DbField] 	 -> Indicates that the property is a field;
			[DbKey]		 -> Well... its a key...
			[DbIdentity] -> The field is the Identity field increasing automatically;
			[DbRequired] -> Allows the framework to check for the required fields before executing SQL commands.
		5) Create a ConnectionString entry in the app.config/web.config file with the name DbConnection.
			[DbConnection | DbConnection-[MachineName]]
title: ORMFramework
